Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed and confused Help?? ShirleyFaye cgill26

Posts.Content: May 27, 2010 01:31AM cgill26 wrote: Jeanwash, sorry you are a member of the club.  While eating well and exercise is good always give yourself a rest too and take this all in.  I had radiation and my only effect was a bad sun burn at the end.  If it is required do not be worried about it.  It is painless just a little frightening at first.  You don't want to rush into decisions!  If you have chemo. you will make it kiddo. I know many ladies personally who did well with some difficulty but it worked and they got through it a lot better then they imagined.  They have been free for yrs. of cancer.  People are very compassionate don't try to hold all this in on your own,  Some of the side effects could make this not such a secret!  I have seen good looking re-construction too!  You will be surprised of how many of us are out there and you'd have no idea! Chin up, get the junk out and enjoy something devilish like choc. cake.  It isn't going to hurt you!!!!!!!!!  Wash it down with an ice cold coke too.I will think of you daily.  I have been CA free for almost seven yrs.  I still have brief panic moments it will return and think I will till something else gets me.  There are many out there like me too!!  Hang In, CG
Posts.Title: Biopy yesterday- today I am a cancer patient!! jeanwash msphil
